column2: KS DMV PRACTICE TEST
column4: Kansas
column6: KS

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. You must come to a full stop at a yield sign:
column4: Never.
column6: Always.
column8: If traffic conditions require it.

column2: 2. Always stop before you cross railroad tracks when:
column4: you are following a bicyclist or motorcyclist across railroad tracks.
column6: you don't have room on the other side to completely cross the tracks.
column8: you are not wearing safety belts.

column2: 3. You may drive faster than the posted speed limit:
column4: when passing another vehicle, as long as it is safe to do so.
column6: when your lane is empty.
column8: Under no circumstances.

column2: 4. When you see this sign you should:
column4: turn right.
column6: watch for traffic to the right.
column8: merge left.

column2: 5. What is the only effective method to reduce your BAC?
column4: Drinking coffee.
column6: Eating before or while you drink.
column8: Not drinking over a period of time.

column2: 6. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column6: enter the two-way road to the right of its center line.
column8: make a U-turn into the two-way road.

column2: 7. Before making a left turn from a one-way street, you must:
column4: be in the lane closest to the right curb.
column6: be in the lane closest to the center of the street.
column8: be in the lane closest to the left curb.

column2: 8. Aggressive driving behaviors can include:
column4: a tendency to drive slow.
column6: excessive following distance.
column8: erratic lane changes.

column2: 9. A defensive driver:
column4: knows when it is safe to pass other vehicles.
column6: never drives below the speed limit.
column8: considers what other drivers might do and is always prepared to act.

column2: 10. After passing a vehicle, it is safe to return to your lane when:
column4: the driver you passed slows down to let you return to your lane.
column6: you can see both headlights of the vehicle you just passed in your rearview mirror.
column8: you are at least 100 feet ahead of the vehicle you passed.

column2: 11. Excessive speed:
column4: saves time so you can get to your destination more quickly.
column6: helps you to maneuver around obstacles.
column8: increases the likelihood of serious bodily injuries and death.

column2: 12. What does the flashing signal in the picture indicate?
column4: The same thing as a stop sign.
column6: Pedestrians should finish crossing the street if started.
column8: Pedestrians should start crossing the street.

column2: 13. Which statement about taking medications and driving is true?
column4: Cold medications can make a person drowsy.
column6: Prescribed drugs are safe to take at any time.
column8: Over the counter drugs do not affect driving ability.

column2: 14. When turning, drivers should:
column4: check traffic in all directions.
column6: increase their speed to improve stability.
column8: always move to the right lane.

column2: 15. At a school crossing, drivers should:
column4: always sound their horn and stay alert.
column6: watch for children and be ready to stop.
column8: always stop, whether there’s a stop sign or not.

column2: 16. This sign indicates that:
column4: there's a side road ahead
column6: trucks are merging from the right
column8: there is a steep hill ahead.

column2: 17. A flashing red light means:
column4: Drive with caution.
column6: The light will soon change to steady red.
column8: The same as a STOP sign.

column2: 18. You want to turn left at an intersection ahead. A car reaches the intersection from the opposite direction and moves straight ahead. You:
column4: can turn left. You have the right of way.
column6: must wait for the car to go through before you turn.
column8: may not enter the intersection to prepare for your left turn if the light is green.

column2: 19. When entering an expressway from the entrance ramp, you should:
column4: use the acceleration lane to blend into the traffic.
column6: cross over to the traffic lane as soon as possible.
column8: go down to the bottom of the ramp and stop until it is safe to enter the expressway.

column2: 20. The use of alcohol and/or drugs affects:
column4: concentration and reaction time.
column6: alertness and judgement.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 21. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: their lane has a solid yellow center line.
column6: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 22. Warning signs normally are:
column4: triangles.
column6: diamond-shaped.
column8: rectangles.

column2: 23. What is the meaning of red traffic signs?
column4: High emphasis warning.
column6: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.
column8: Regulatory.

column2: 24. When drivers see the ‘Wrong Way’ sign:
column4: they must drive past this sign and reach the next intersection.
column6: they must not leave the pavement except in an emergency.
column8: they are going the wrong way on an expressway exit ramp.

column2: 25. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
column4: Stop sign
column6: Red light
column8: Police officer
